Description: A pottery flask modelled in the round as a standing cockerel, with the mouth, neck and handles in the form of an amphora (closely resembling an Italian Dressel 1B of about 75-10 BC) emerging from its back. With a rounded rough base, slightly concave underneath. Two-piece mould: both sides are decorated. Micaceous dark-brown Nile silt with a dark-brown slip overall except under base: poor quality Memphis Black Ware; traces of an overall white dressing.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Ptolemaic, first century BC.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3770)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
